user.title: Select Sofabaton hub
user.description: Select the Sofabaton hub that was discovered on your network, or choose manual setup if yours isnâ€™t listed.

manual.title: Manual hub setup
manual.description: Provide a name, IP address, and port for your Sofabaton hub. The name you choose here will become the name of your virtual hub and cannot be changed later. Leave the hub port at its default, this setting will be removed in the future.

ports.title: Proxy ports
ports.description: These ports are used by the local proxy that emulates the hub. UDP now defaults to 8102 for iOS compatibility; changing it applies to all hubs and may prevent iOS from discovering the virtual hub. UDP is there so that the official app can find the virtual hubs. TCP is there so that the physical hub can connect to the integration. Each hub that you add to this integration will share the same UDP port, but will bind its own TCP port. The integration will try up to 32 ports, starting at TCP Listener port base, to find an available port.

data.hub_listen_base: TCP listener port base (for the physical hub to connect)
data.proxy_udp_port: UDP Listener port (for the app to connect)

zeroconf_confirm.title: Discovered Sofabaton hub
zeroconf_confirm.description: Home Assistant found a Sofabaton hub ({{name}} @ {{host}}). Confirm to set it up.
